thread.title: Buffalo State pulls upset, ECC loses
thread.title_full: Buffalo State pulls upset, ECC loses - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Buffalo State pulls upset, ECC loses
text:
Buffalo State overcame a 12-point halftime deficit and handed 18th-ranked Cortland State its first loss of the season, 29-21, Saturday afternoon in their Empire 8 Conference football game at Coyer Field.
Coach Jerry Boyes’ Bengals outscored the Red Dragons, 21-0, in the second half to earn their second straight victory and improve their overall record to 3-2. Buffalo State is 2-2 in conference play.
In Orchard Park, College of DuPage (Ill.), ranked eighth in this week’s NJCAA poll, triumphed over Erie Community College, 51-21, at West-Herr Stadium.
Cortland quarterback Steve Ferreira passed for two touchdowns and Carson Lassiter returned an interception 59 yards for a touchdown to put the visitors in front of Buffalo State, 21-9, at halftime. But Aaron Ertel (Depew) threw two touchdown passes in the second half, capping long drives, and Dale Stewart (Niagara Falls) broke away on an 84-yard touchdown run. Stewart, who also scored on a 1-yard run in the second quarter, put the Bengals in the lead, 22-21, with 1:36 left in the third.
Ertel completed 24 of 43 passes for 277 yards, Joe Oca caught nine passes for 93 yards, including a 23-yarder for a TD. Stewart finished with 102 rushing yards.
Buffalo State outgained the Red Dragons, 456-441. Cortland (5-1, 3-1), which was averaging 43.2 points per game, was limited to 170 yards in the second half. John Alessandra (Kenmore East) and Shaq Frederick had nine tackles each. Anthony Sanders (McKinley) and Khalil Sommerville (Bennett) had two sacks each.
Devin O’Hare passed for four touchdowns and ran for another as DuPage (5-0) pinned a fourth straight loss on ECC. Sam Castronova (Williamsville South) passed to Xavier Maye and Joe Fortson for touchdowns to tie the game at 14 in the second quarter.
